page.title: 17RELIGION
page.content: The parish Church was linked with Lincluden in 1962. There have been 13 ministers since 1779 the present one being a woman- Mrs. May Hutchison. Sunday service is at 10am with Sunday school during part of the service. Communion is held at the end of March and September with Harvest Thanksgiving in early October.An average attendance is around 40.The Womans Guild celebrated their Centenery with a flower festival. Two stained glass windows have recently been presented by the Weatheral family in memory of the late Mr David Keswick and his wife Barley Peas. {CHURCH BELLS.}Two bells from the old Abbey hang in the belfry. People who do not belong to The Church Of Scotland go to worship outwith the area.
